1.text: And Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

2.text: Can a man be profitable to God? surely it is unto himself that the wise man is profitable.

3.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty if thou art righteous? And is it gain [to him] that thou makest thy ways perfect?

4.text: Will he reason with thee for fear of thee? Will he enter with thee into judgment?

5.text: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities without end?

6.text: For thou hast taken a pledge of thy brother for nought, and stripped off the clothing of the naked.

7.text: Thou hast not given water to the fainting to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

8.text: But the powerful man, he had the land; and the man of high rank dwelt in it.

9.text: Widows hast thou sent empty away, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

11.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see, and floods of waters cover thee.

12.text: Is not +God in the height of the heavens? And behold the summit of the stars: how exalted are they!

13.text: And thou sayest, What doth God know? will he judge through the dark cloud?

14.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh on the vault of the heavens.

15.text: Dost thou mark the ancient path which wicked men have trodden?

16.text: Who were carried off before the time, whose foundation was overflowed with a flood;

17.text: Who said unto God, Depart from us! and what could the Almighty do to them?

18.text: Yet he filled their houses with good. But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.text: The righteous see it, and are glad; and the innocent laugh them to scorn:

20.text: Is not he who rose against us destroyed, and doth not the fire consume his residue?

21.text: Reconcile thyself now with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

22.text: Receive, I pray thee, instruction from his mouth, and lay up his words in thy heart.

23.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up. If thou remove unrighteousness far from thy tents,

24.text: And put the precious ore with the dust, and [the gold of] Ophir among the stones of the torrents,

25.text: Then the Almighty will be thy precious ore, and silver heaped up unto thee;

26.text: Yea, then shalt thou delight thyself in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto +God:

27.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he will hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows;

28.text: And thou shalt decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; and light shall shine upon thy ways.

29.text: When they are made low, then thou shalt say, Rise up! and he shall save him that is of downcast eyes.

30.text: [Even] him that is not innocent shall he deliver; yea, he shall be delivered by the pureness of thy hands.
